question: What is the primary goal of supervised learning?
options: To discover hidden patterns
To predict outcomes based on labeled data
To group similar data points
To reduce dimensionality
correct_answer: To predict outcomes based on labeled data

question: What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: When a model is too simple
When a model is too complex and fits the noise
When a model is not trained enough
When a model is not tested enough
correct_answer: When a model is too complex and fits the noise

question: What is the purpose of cross-validation?
options: To evaluate model performance on unseen data
To train a model on the entire dataset
To select the best features
To tune hyperparameters
correct_answer: To evaluate model performance on unseen data

question: What is the difference between classification and regression?
options: Classification predicts continuous values, while regression predicts categorical values
Classification predicts categorical values, while regression predicts continuous values
Classification is used for clustering, while regression is used for dimensionality reduction
Classification is used for feature selection, while regression is used for model evaluation
correct_answer: Classification predicts categorical values, while regression predicts continuous values

question: What is the purpose of principal component analysis (PCA)?
options: To select the most informative features
To reduce dimensionality while retaining most of the information
To cluster similar data points
To predict outcomes based on labeled data
correct_answer: To reduce dimensionality while retaining most of the information

question: What is the difference between a Type I error and a Type II error?
options: Type I error is a false positive, while Type II error is a false negative
Type I error is a false negative, while Type II error is a false positive
Type I error is a true positive, while Type II error is a true negative
Type I error is a true negative, while Type II error is a true positive
correct_answer: Type I error is a false positive, while Type II error is a false negative

question: What is the purpose of the F1 score?
options: To evaluate the accuracy of a model
To evaluate the precision of a model
To evaluate the recall of a model
To evaluate the balance between precision and recall
correct_answer: To evaluate the balance between precision and recall

question: What is the difference between bagging and boosting?
options: Bagging is a boosting technique, while boosting is a bagging technique
Bagging reduces overfitting, while boosting increases overfitting
Bagging combines multiple models, while boosting combines multiple weak learners
Bagging is used for classification, while boosting is used for regression
correct_answer: Bagging combines multiple models, while boosting combines multiple weak learners

question: What is the purpose of the confusion matrix?
options: To evaluate the performance of a model
To select the best features
To tune hyperparameters
To predict outcomes based on labeled data
correct_answer: To evaluate the performance of a model

question: What is the difference between a parametric and non-parametric model?
options: Parametric models assume a specific distribution, while non-parametric models do not
Parametric models are used for regression, while non-parametric models are used for classification
Parametric models are used for small datasets, while non-parametric models are used for large datasets
Parametric models are more complex, while non-parametric models are simpler
correct_answer: Parametric models assume a specific distribution, while non-parametric models do not

question: What is the purpose of feature scaling?
options: To reduce dimensionality
To improve model interpretability
To ensure features are on the same scale
To select the most informative features
correct_answer: To ensure features are on the same scale

question: What is the difference between a decision tree and a random forest?
options: A decision tree is a type of random forest
A random forest is a type of decision tree
A decision tree is a single model, while a random forest is an ensemble of models
A decision tree is used for regression, while a random forest is used for classification
correct_answer: A decision tree is a single model, while a random forest is an ensemble of models

question: What is the purpose of the ROC-AUC curve?
options: To evaluate the performance of a model
To select the best features
To tune hyperparameters
To predict outcomes based on labeled data
correct_answer: To evaluate the performance of a model

question: What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data
Supervised learning is used for classification, while unsupervised learning is used for regression
Supervised learning is used for small datasets, while unsupervised learning is used for large datasets
Supervised learning is more complex, while unsupervised learning is simpler
correct_answer: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data

question: What is the purpose of clustering?
options: To group similar data points
To predict outcomes based on labeled data
To reduce dimensionality
To evaluate model performance
correct_answer: To group similar data points

question: What is the difference between k-means and hierarchical clustering?
options: K-means is a type of hierarchical clustering
Hierarchical clustering is a type of k-means
K-means requires a fixed number of clusters, while hierarchical clustering does not
K-means is used for small datasets, while hierarchical clustering is used for large datasets
correct_answer: K-means requires a fixed number of clusters, while hierarchical clustering does not

question: What is the purpose of the elbow method?
options: To determine the optimal number of clusters
To evaluate model performance
To select the best features
To tune hyperparameters
correct_answer: To determine the optimal number of clusters

question: What is the difference between L1 and L2 regularization?
options: L1 regularization adds a penalty term to the loss function, while L2 regularization does not
L1 regularization is used for feature selection, while L2 regularization is used for model complexity reduction
L1 regularization is more robust to outliers, while L2 regularization is more sensitive to outliers
L1 regularization is used for classification, while L2 regularization is used for regression
correct_answer: L1 regularization is used for feature selection, while L2 regularization is used for model complexity reduction

question: What is the purpose of a neural network?
options: To predict outcomes based on labeled data
To group similar data points
To reduce dimensionality
To learn complex patterns in data
correct_answer: To learn complex patterns in data

question: What is the difference between a convolutional neural network (CNN) and a recurrent neural network (RNN)?
options: CNNs are used for sequential data, while RNNs are used for image data
CNNs are used for image data, while RNNs are used for sequential data
CNNs are more complex, while RNNs are simpler
CNNs are used for classification, while RNNs are used for regression
correct_answer: CNNs are used for image data, while RNNs are used for sequential data

question: What is the purpose of transfer learning?
options: To train a model from scratch
To fine-tune a pre-trained model
To select the best features
To evaluate model performance
correct_answer: To fine-tune a pre-trained model

question: What is the difference between batch normalization and dropout?
options: Batch normalization normalizes the input data, while dropout randomly drops out neurons
Batch normalization reduces overfitting, while dropout increases overfitting
Batch normalization is used for convolutional layers, while dropout is used for fully connected layers
Batch normalization is used for small datasets, while dropout is used for large datasets
correct_answer: Batch normalization normalizes the input data, while dropout randomly drops out neurons

question: What is the purpose of the activation function?
options: To introduce non-linearity into the model
To reduce dimensionality
To select the best features
To evaluate model performance
correct_answer: To introduce non-linearity into the model

question: What is the difference between mean squared error (MSE) and mean absolute error (MAE)?
options: MSE is more sensitive to outliers, while MAE is less sensitive to outliers
MSE is less sensitive to outliers, while MAE is more sensitive to outliers
MSE is used for classification, while MAE is used for regression
MSE is used for small datasets, while MAE is used for large datasets
correct_answer: MSE is more sensitive to outliers, while MAE is less sensitive to outliers

question: What is the purpose of feature engineering?
options: To select the most informative features
To create new features from existing ones
To reduce dimensionality
To evaluate model performance
correct_answer: To create new features from existing ones
